alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 3:43PM MST until August 21 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR THE MARBLE CANYON AREA SOUTH OF LEES FERRY... At 341 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen, and light to moderate rainfall will continue for the next hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bitter Springs, Tanner Wash, Hwy 89a. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 523 and 532. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 534...and between mile markers 543 and 556. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Colorado River, Jackass Creek, Emmett Wash, House Rock Wash, Tanner Wash, Badger Canyon, Fall Creek, South Fork Soap Creek and Soap Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
